adjectives.description: recompensing (comparative more recompensing, superlative most recompensing)

entries.meaning: That provides recompense; rewarding, compensatory. [from 16th c.]
examples: And such the recompensing Heav'n of those, / The happy few, who truly great of soul / Are masters of themselves [...].

entries.meaning: The act of rewarding or compensating; reward, compensation. [from 15th c.]
examples: He bringeth counsellors also to a foolish end, when they do anything good even, with no good purpose, but are going after the recompensing of a temporal reward.
